trans-unit.source: How to use Media Services with Java
trans-unit.target: How to use Media Services with Java

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use Azure Media Services to perform common tasks including encoding, encrypting, and streaming resources.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use Azure Media Services to perform common tasks including encoding, encrypting, and streaming resources.

trans-unit.source: How to use Media Services with Java
trans-unit.target: How to use Media Services with Java

trans-unit.source: Setting Up an Azure Account for Media Services
trans-unit.target: Setting Up an Azure Account for Media Services

trans-unit.source: To set up your Media Services account, use the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To set up your Media Services account, use the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: After creating your account in the Management Portal, you are ready to set up your computer for Media Services development.
trans-unit.target: After creating your account in the Management Portal, you are ready to set up your computer for Media Services development.

trans-unit.source: Setting up for Media Services development
trans-unit.target: Setting up for Media Services development

trans-unit.source: This section contains general prerequisites for Media Services development using the Media Services SDK for Java.
trans-unit.target: This section contains general prerequisites for Media Services development using the Media Services SDK for Java.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account in a new or existing Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account in a new or existing Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: The Azure Libraries for Java, which you can install from the [Azure Java Developer Center][].
trans-unit.target: The Azure Libraries for Java, which you can install from the [Azure Java Developer Center][].

trans-unit.source: How to: Use Media Services with Java
trans-unit.target: How to: Use Media Services with Java

trans-unit.source: The following code shows how to create an asset, upload a media file to the asset, run a job with a task to transform the asset, and download the output files of the transformed asset.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows how to create an asset, upload a media file to the asset, run a job with a task to transform the asset, and download the output files of the transformed asset.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to set up a media services account before using this code.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to set up a media services account before using this code.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting up an account, see [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about setting up an account, see [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Substitute your values for the `clientId` and `clientSecret` variables.
trans-unit.target: Substitute your values for the `clientId` and `clientSecret` variables.

trans-unit.source: The code also relies on a locally stored file, `c:/media/MPEG4-H264.mp4`.
trans-unit.target: The code also relies on a locally stored file, `c:/media/MPEG4-H264.mp4`.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to provide your own file to use.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to provide your own file to use.

trans-unit.source: The code also requires an output folder, `c:/output`, which is where the output files will be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: The code also requires an output folder, `c:/output`, which is where the output files will be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The assets that you create are stored in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The assets that you create are stored in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: However, use only the Azure media services APIs (not Azure storage APIs) to add, update, or delete assets.
trans-unit.target: However, use only the Azure media services APIs (not Azure storage APIs) to add, update, or delete assets.

trans-unit.source: Determining which media processors are available
trans-unit.target: Determining which media processors are available

trans-unit.source: The code above used a media processor by accessing it via a specific media processor name (and if there was more than one version, it would use the latest version).
trans-unit.target: The code above used a media processor by accessing it via a specific media processor name (and if there was more than one version, it would use the latest version).

trans-unit.source: To determine which media processors are available, you could use the following code.
trans-unit.target: To determine which media processors are available, you could use the following code.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the following code shows how to retrieve the ID of a media processor by name.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the following code shows how to retrieve the ID of a media processor by name.

trans-unit.source: Canceling a job
trans-unit.target: Canceling a job

trans-unit.source: Should you need to cancel a job that hasn't finished processing, the following code shows how to cancel a job by job ID.
trans-unit.target: Should you need to cancel a job that hasn't finished processing, the following code shows how to cancel a job by job ID.
